intro: Sphaeralcea sandemanii, commonly known as Sandeman's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Sphaeralcea sandemanii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
